title: Fuller: Predictors of Christian Nationalism
text:
0.1 Present Study
Given the unique position seminary students are in, we recognize the need to identify narcissism and its predictors.
The present study will examine rates of narcissism (grandiosity and vulnerability) in seminary students, and identify predictors which may help community stakeholders and clinicians make informed decisions on care and leadership appointment.






Note



The rationale above is not final, and may need revision.


We will be examining three broad categories and specific measures proposed below:
Character: Humility, Self-control, forgiveness.
Mental Distress: Depression, Anxiety, Shame.
Spirituality: Prayer, spiritual struggle, Spiritual discipline.






Note



Worth noting that sample size for T4-T6 is 365 while sample size for T5-T6 is 452. Given this substantial difference in sample size, we will conduct analyses with T5-T6.




Show the code
# Rename variables
# data <- rename(data, 
#                # SEXUAL ORIENTATION
#                sexori6_1 = q7_75_6, # straight
#                sexori6_2 = q7_76_6, # gay/lesbian
#                sexori6_3 = q7_77_6, # bisexual
#                sexori6_other = q7_78_6, # other?
#                sexori6_no = q7_79_6, # no disclose
#                # RACE
#                race6_1 = q6_58_6, # AAPI
#                race6_2 = q6_59_6, # Black/African descent
#                race6_3 = q6_60_6, # Latin/Hispanic
#                race6_4 = q6_61_6, # Indigenous/Native American
#                race6_5 = q6_62_6, # White
#                race6_other = q6_63_6, # Other
#                race6_no = q6_64_6, # no disclosure
#                # MISC
#                status6_0 = q11_6, # Student status (full/part)
#                deg6_1 = q12_95_6, # Masters
#                deg6_2 = q12_96_6, # M.Div.
#                deg6_3 = q12_97_6, # Th.M.
#                deg6_4 = q12_98_6, # Certificate
#                deg6_5 = q12_99_6, # Non-degree
#                deg6_6 = q12_100_6, # MAPS
#                status6_1 = q14_6 # Remote/Learning
#)




Show the code
data <- data %>%
  mutate(sexori6 = case_when(
    sexori6_2 == 1 | sexori6_3 == 1 | sexori6_other == 1 ~ "Lesbian/Gay/Bisexual",
    sexori6_1 == 1 ~ "Straight/Heterosexual",
    TRUE ~ NA_character_
  ))

data <- data %>%
  mutate(rac6_col = case_when(
    race6_1 == 1 | race6_2 == 1 | race6_3 == 1 | race6_4 == 1 | race6_other == 1 ~ 1,
    race6_5 == 1 ~ 0,
    TRUE ~ NA_real_
  ))

# data <- data %>%
#   mutate(sexori4 = case_when(
#     sexori4_2 == 1 | sexori4_3 == 1 | sexori4_other == 1 ~ "Lesbian/Gay/Bisexual",
#     sexori4_1 == 1 ~ "Straight/Heterosexual",
#     TRUE ~ NA_character_
#   ))
# 
# data <- data %>%
#   mutate(rac6_col = case_when(
#     race4_1 == 1 | race4_2 == 1 | race4_3 == 1 | race4_4 == 1 | race4_other == 1 ~ 1,
#     race4_5 == 1 ~ 0,
#     TRUE ~ NA_real_
#   ))

data$rac6_col <- sjlabelled::set_labels(data$rac6_col, labels = c("White", "Non-White"))

title: Fuller: Predictors of Christian Nationalism
text:
2.1 Preliminary Analyses


Show the code
# data <- data %>%
#   mutate(

#     PNIV6r = scale(var2)

title: Fuller: Predictors of Christian Nationalism
text:
2.2 Temporal Variables


Show the code
# Narcissism
data$PNIGt <- (data$PNIG6r - data$PNIG5r)
data$PNIVt <- (data$PNIV6r - data$PNIV5r)

# Character
data$HUMt <- (data$HUM6r - data$HUM5r)
data$FORGSt <- (data$FORGS6r - data$FORGS5r)
data$FORGOt <- (data$FORGO6r - data$FORGO5r)
data$COMPt <- (data$COMP6r - data$COMP5r)

# Spirituality
data$SSGt <- (data$SSG6r - data$SSG5r)
data$SPDSt <- (data$SPDS6r - data$SPDS5r)
data$SCRIt <- (data$SCRI6r - data$SCRI5r)
data$PRAYt <- (data$PRAY6r - data$PRAY5r)

# Outcome Variable
data$CNATt <- (data$CNAT6r - data$CNAT5r)

# Social Values
data$SJCt <- (data$SJC6r - data$SJC5r)
data$ICt <- (data$IC6r - data$IC5r)

data$SIMt <- (data$SIM6r - data$SIM5r)


Before running multiple regression, test for multicollinearity.


Show the code
selected_vars <- c("CNATt",
                   "PNIGt", "PNIVt", 
                   "age4", "gender4", "rac6_col", 
                   "HUMt", "FORGOt", "FORGSt", "COMPt",
                   "PRAYt", "SSGt", "SPDSt", "SCRIt",
                   "SJCt", "ICt")
bys_data <- subset(data, select = selected_vars)
# Correlation
bys_table <- apa.cor.table(bys_data, 
                        table.number=1)
apa.save(filename = "cor_table.doc",
         bys_table)

Note



Correlation matrix indicates that Mental Distress is highly correlated with one another, indicating multicollinearity. Given the examination of predictors of narcissism, mental distress will be removed for subsequent analyses.

title: Fuller: Predictors of Christian Nationalism
text:
2.3 Multiple Regression Model
Character: Humility, Self-control, forgiveness.
Spirituality: Prayer, spiritual struggle, Spiritual discipline.

2.3.1 Christian Naitonalism


Show the code
summary(lm(CNATt ~ gender5 + rac6_col + SCRIt + SPDSt, data = data))



Call:
lm(formula = CNATt ~ gender5 + rac6_col + SCRIt + SPDSt, data = data)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-7.9694 -1.7493 -0.1813  1.6913  8.8143 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)  
(Intercept)  0.22479    0.20637   1.089   0.2767  
gender5     -0.45083    0.25455  -1.771   0.0773 .
rac6_col     0.14182    0.26343   0.538   0.5906  
SCRIt       -0.02467    0.06675  -0.370   0.7119  
SPDSt       -0.01447    0.04040  -0.358   0.7204  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 2.661 on 433 degrees of freedom
  (7 observations deleted due to missingness)
Multiple R-squared:  0.008608,  Adjusted R-squared:  -0.0005503 
F-statistic: 0.9399 on 4 and 433 DF,  p-value: 0.4406


Show the code
cor.test(data$CNATt, data$SJCt)



    Pearson's product-moment correlation

data:  data$CNATt and data$SJCt
t = 0.78816, df = 443, p-value = 0.431
alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -0.0557303  0.1299253
sample estimates:
       cor 
0.03742039

    data = data)

Residuals:

-7.4931 -1.6677 -0.1091  1.6989  8.8881 

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)   
(Intercept)  0.268638   0.205643   1.306  0.19213   
gender5     -0.440179   0.252854  -1.741  0.08242 . 
rac6_col     0.099580   0.262131   0.380  0.70422   
SSGt         0.148303   0.056258   2.636  0.00869 **
SCRIt       -0.006964   0.066640  -0.105  0.91681   
SPDSt       -0.001515   0.040424  -0.037  0.97013   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 2.643 on 432 degrees of freedom
  (7 observations deleted due to missingness)
Multiple R-squared:  0.0243,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.01301 
F-statistic: 2.152 on 5 and 432 DF,  p-value: 0.05843








Important



Results indicate Age, Humility, and Forgiveness of Others are significant predictors of `Grandiosity`.
